column1: Topic title: Liow Tiong Lai  It Will Be A Better Year In 2017

column8: Remembering the less fortunate: Liow giving out CNY goodies to nearly 1,000 elderly people at a charity programme in Pudu, Kuala Lumpur.The country’s transformation plan is starting to bear fruit and the people can expect a better year in 2017, says MCA president Datuk Seri Liow Tiong Lai.He said the country’s economic growth was forecast to be around 5% this year, higher than the 4% recorded last year.“Crude oil and palm oil prices have increased by 20% while rubber price has also gone up more than RM4 from the previous RM2.“With all these positive internal and external factors in place, I believe the value of the ringgit will also go up,” he added.Liow said the development projects to propel Malaysia to become a high-income nation were progressing as scheduled. Major cities such as Kuala Lumpur, Johor Baru, Malacca and Kuantan would see a quantum leap in development in the near future.As Transport Minister, he said the ports, railway tracks and systems were being upgraded to enhance connectivity.“No town or village, including Bentong, shall be left out in the country’s development plans,” he told the people here at Bentong MCA division’s Chinese New Year open house yesterday.He said the century-old town would become a good role model to demonstrate that it was possible to transform a quiet town into a prosperous city.“Let everyone witness how this small town transforms into a prosperous city,” he added.A roadshow, he announced, would be held to inform the people on the progress of the development plans while seeking their feedback to map out the future direction of the town.Liow also said that the national-level Chinese New Year open house would be held in the town on Feb 12.“This is a festival celebrated by all races in Bentong.“We not only celebrate the festival, we also popularise this town to make it a major tourist destination,” he added to the crowd’s applause.Earlier in Kuala Lumpur, Liow handed out Chinese New Year goodies to nearly 1,000 elderly and less fortunate people at a charity programme organised by the Welfare Society of Loke Yuen Pudu KL.He gave the assurance that the Government would undertake all measures to boost the economy to reduce the people’s financial burden.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...transformation/

More Items to Collect GST 1st July, Terima kasih BN60 more food item to be gst-ed start 1 july, syukur.jpgGST zero-rates list item berkurang bukan tambah18 Jun 2017https://forum.lowyat.net/topic/4329906https://forum.lowyat.net/topic/4330045https://forum.lowyat.net/topic/4330015...More than 60 types of food items will have the Goods and Services Tax (GST) imposed on them starting July 1....“It’s only a few items not consumed by the masses,” he said....However, vegetables such as potatoes, long beans, peas, spinach and sweet corn would also be taken off the GST zero-rated list....Other items include bihun, kuey teow, laksa mee and coconut oil.
